author: SO22
title: Concern about surgical procedure
body: I am currently awaiting surgery for bowel cancer and am going to be admitted to Montacute Ward next week. I am absolutely petrified about the surgery. What is Montacute Ward like? And will they try to calm my nerves without the need for drugs ?

readBy.name: Somerset NHS Foundation Trust

author: taurusbp48
title: Kind and gentle experience at Dexa scan
body:
I recently had a Dexa Scan with trainee Ben supervised by Karl.  
I couldn't have been treated more kindly! I was given time to ask/answer any questions, my privacy was respected and when being positioned or repositioned Ben was very gentle and professional, explaining what he was doing.  
Thank you both for a very good experience.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: TriathlonJohn
title: Your wonderful Minor Injuries Unit
body:
Cut my knee clearing up on some rubbish abandoned by the side of the Hathersage Hilly triathlon course last Sunday.  
Popped down to MIU first thing Monday morning to check if it needed stitches and/or a tetanus jab. Third in the queue, before the unit opened at 8.00 am (promptly) by a cheerful receptionist and was still seen by a lovely nurse at 8.20 am for 3 stitches and that tetanus jab.  
Professional, polite, patient, cheerful staff at every point - thank you NHS, Royal Hallamshire and the wonderful team at MIU.

readBy.name: Healthwatch Sheffield
Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Thankful to the staff
body:
My care has been very good so far and I am more than happy with the care that I have been receiving in the hospital as it has honestly been incredible. I am thankful to all the staff who have facilitated such a wonderful level of care. The nurses have been brilliant and all the staff are so kind and amazing. They have all been incredible at explaining everything which has kept me so up to date.  
The food is excellent with the only time it wasn’t being last night due to it being cold. I have had no issues and am excited about my care

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: The staff are out of this world
body:
Accident and emergency was fast acting, they were so quick about everything which I was so glad of. The staff were lovely also and were trying their best.  
Daisy ward is something else, I have never been in here since this is my first child but it was not what I was expecting. The place is clean and modern. I love the individual rooms since there is so much privacy.  
The staff are out of this world, they are always busy but have time for you. They never rush you or make you feel like you are asking a stupid question. I am so happy with everything.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Nurses are brilliant
body:
The care that I have received I am very happy with and I can honestly say that I am so thankful for the care that I have received so far. The care has been so good thanks to the amazing staff that I have come into contact with. The nurses are brilliant and have been so nice towards me since I arrived and have done their best to make sure I am comfortable. The doctors are the same and have explained everything.  
The food is actually delicious and up to now I have had no issues since arrival

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Cocomac
title: Fantastic maternity care in the Scottish Borders
body:
From the moment I found out I was pregnant I have nothing but positive comments to make regarding the support from maternity staff. From the community midwives, my consultant to the nursing staff that supported with the birth of my baby girl at the start of July.  
My community midwife in Galashiels supported with anxieties around pregnancy, struggling with change and also external factors. Her manner and approach made me feel really supported which I am so grateful for. What's more having her throughout the whole pregnancy was fantastic for continuity and having that same friendly face.  
When I went into labour at the BGH I found all the nursing staff and student nurses amazing. They couldn't do enough to keep my partner and I calm, comfortable and informed. We were looked after by the most wonderful senior midwife and student nurse who ensured we knew what was going on at all times from the moment we entered, to the emergency C section to the next day when she had arrived. Ward 16 looked after my baby girl and I for two days after, supporting with, breastfeeding and the emotional rollercoaster that is birth. They ensured not only my baby was well but me as a new mumma, something you don't think of when you have a little person to look after.  
Aftercare from the community midwives for the 10 days before health visiting take over was really supportive, encouraging positive feeding experiences, whatever that may be for me and my baby and ensuring that we are both doing well I was given lots of information and tips that have been invaluable.  
I honestly can't thank all the staff enough as I don't think my experience would of been the same without the team effort of the staff involved in my care and the support given to my partner and baby girl. Thank you, thank you, thank you.

readBy.name: NHS Borders

author: Mark51
title: Great treatment from the staff
body:
I have had gallbladder problems.  
The treatment from the staff , both seniors and junior was great.  
Food was actually good.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Quick work…..
body:
Visited the surgery earlier this week complaining of severe stomach pains.  Returned the following day with faecal samples and for a blood test.  Result of samples and a prescription for antibiotics delivered inside 24 hours. Recovery now on course.
Much impressed, and relieved, by the quiet efficiency of the staff, and the speed with which they addressed my complaint.

author: blueme95
title: A visit to urgent care
body:
I had treatment for a hand injury. The service from 111 to treatment was outstanding.  
The main reason for writing is there is zero GDPR compliance on the urgent care check in desk. You have to give all of your details in the middle of a packed and echoing waiting room where every one can hear your business including your address, date of birth and phone number.  
I found it very embarrassing describing the nature my injury to all and sundry.

readBy.name: Royal Cornwall Hospitals NHS Trust

author: L Stevenson
title: A&E attendance
body:
My father had to attend because of chest pain.  
Despite the department being extremely busy he received outstanding professional care from all of the team.  
All members went above and beyond - particular thanks need to be given to Mari Ann, Margaret Rose and Dot. You are all amazing!

readBy.name: NHS Lanarkshire

author: GFors71
title: Wonderful staff on Craigavon ED and Craigavon Xray and CT dept
body:
We arrived with my Dad at Craigavon hospital yesterday morning having fallen, a female support worker was on her way to start her shift and stopped with us asking if she could help. I explained what had happened and she said she would get us a porter and a nurse out to car to help. They arrived with a chair but the lovely Matthew (agency nurse) assessed the situation and said they would get a trolley as it would be easier on Dad. Our experience was positive throughout as Mathew took charge and explained all to Dad and ensured we were kept informed. We encountered several staff in ED who always ensured Dad was comfortable, I didn’t catch all the names - there was Leah, a staff nurse, Roisin, a staff nurse, Roisin a student nurse in yellow area and a nurse with a plait in yellow area. There was a lovely HCA who is a first year medical student who held Dads ear together while David, the Consultant, was meticulous about carefully stitching his ear. These staff were under extreme pressure in a busy ED dept, yet they never compromised on care and gave Dad the attention he required. Nothing was a bother to them.  
I also want to commend the radiographers who undertook Dads imaging, Darren and Aoife who were courteous, professional and lovely to Dad. They then took him to the CT dept for a head scan and Chris the radiographer explained to Dad what was going to happen to allay his fears as he is a man in his 80s who luckily has had little experience of hospitals. The radiographers were very accommodating of Dad's confused state and did as much as possible to ensure he was not distressed.  
I cannot relay how thankful I am to all the staff involved in Dad's attendance to ED and imaging yesterday.  
A wonderful health service which should be appreciated.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Content with everything
body: Arrived in Lurgan only a number of days ago, through the ED. All staff have been very nice, very pleased with the care I am receiving. Food is a good standard. Cleanliness is great. Wouldn’t make any changes to my stay, very content with everything.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: The standard here is outstanding
body:
Daisy ward has been very good, the standard here is outstanding. The way they look after my son and interact with him is so good to see. They all love their jobs and you can tell by the way they carry themselves. They must care for everyone individually, the way they look after my son the treatment is unique to him. The place is so new and spotless, there is no dirt about. The ward is as welcoming as can be they try to make it a home from home.  
The staff are so friendly, and nice to us. They make it seem like nothing is a problem to them.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: It is easy to rest in Lurgan
body: Came over few nights ago to Lurgan hospital, by ED from Craigavon. Nurses are all amazing very grateful for the brilliant care. Food is lovely, great variety. Cleaners do a very well done job, floors always shining. Very relaxed here in lurgan a lot more peaceful than Craigavon easier to rest, especially at night.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Lovely and down to earth
body: Arrived in Lurgan the other day, came over through the ED. Not a big eater and also would tend to be a little bit fussy so the meals have been standard, just okay. Look forward to my tea and biscuits the most. Nurses are all wonderful, so lovely and down to earth. Cleanliness is perfect, absolutely no complaints.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Excellent standard of care
body:
Accident and emergency was okay, I know they are trying their best but they need more staff to help out with the waiting times.  
I feel bad for the staff the pressure they are under is way too much.  
Daisy ward does not feel like it is a part of this hospital. Not in a bad way it is just so new and different. The rooms are well needed since it is babies crying, and you do not want to keep anyone else up.  
The staff’s standard of care is excellent they really care about everyone. They keep updated with everything and what is going to happen.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: The level of care is excellent
body:
We came through GP referral. Daisy ward has been good, the level of care is excellent. The ward is new and the rooms are good. The en-suites are good and the TV is a good addition to keep my son entertained. Just annoying being in here with the good weather.  
The staff are good, they are so open and do not sugar coat the truth. I am glad they tell me everything of what is happening it helps make me content.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Sadly angry
title: My father's care
body:
My father was transferred to Aberdeen Royal Infirmary in March from Dr Gray's Hospital, Elgin for surgery, which I must say he came through no problem, but instead of being transferred back, he was in Aberdeen hospital for almost 3 weeks.  
Due to covid my mother was not able to travel to see him but once as the journey was about 2 and half hours (she ended up with covid not sure if that was from the bus or from the ward) as he tested positive as well.  
I was calling every day from Australia to hear any updates but they kept saying they wanted him to get back to his physical health pre hospital. No one asked what that was and how my mother managed to care for him at home, as he was 91 years old.  
She asked for him to be sent home and they sent him home the day after his 92nd birthday in an ambulance...he arrived home in the evening after this he passed away 1 hr later. Not only that but his toiletries and slippers where left behind in the hospital.  
My mother is still very angry and I never got to say farewell until the funeral, I had not seen my father for over 4 years.  
I feel let down by the Scottish health service which I worked in for over 20 years myself.

readBy.name: NHS Grampian

author: Sept16Feb21
title: Pain free for the first time in a week
body:
Could you please pass on my huge thanks to the team who was working the Emergency Dentist clinic today based at Hawick. All the staff where fantastic - receptionist, dental nurses and dentist.  
I was expecting to need my tooth removed - I did visit my own dentist on Tuesday but antibiotics unfortunately were not working. The dentist managed to complete a procedure to save my tooth and a change of antibiotics to hopefully keep me out of pain until I can go back and see my own dentist.  
They where fantastic with my son as well who came with me, and was over the moon to get two stickers.  
They had a really busy clinic but they took their time and treated me with respect and dignity.  
Brilliant service and forever thankful... plus I am pain free for the first time in a week!

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students
NHS Education for Scotland
NHS Borders

author: Judjx86
title: Lack of contact with diabetes nurse
body:
I am so fed up with having no contact with my diabetic nurse.  
Being diabetic is bad enough but when you have no one there to help you what are you supposed to do.  
I have been type 2 for a while now since covid I haven’t seen my nurse. I have spoke to them three times.  
I finally got to talk to a diabetic person from David Mathews clinic who helped out but still nothing from my own nurse.  
My eyes and feet are not good and my bloods are up and down

readBy.name: Scottish Government
NHS Lanarkshire

links.id: speaking to you as a human and showing you care

author: speccy4eyes
title: Dietitian service
body:
Wonderful service from this department. A new computer system was being implemented and it was a difficult time for all the staff.  
Despite a slight hiccup they went above and beyond and even delivered to my home the meal replacement supplement I needed.  
Well done guys.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: DW22
title: I can’t fault anything
body:
Came in for steroid injection in my hip. I was on ward 1. All the nursing staff on the ward and in theatre were brilliant. They and Dr Heaton explained everything.  
Theatre was lovely and cool on such a scorching hot day. The procedure went well. I can’t fault anything.  
Very grateful to the NHS as always.

readBy.name: United Lincolnshire Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: great ward
body: I brought my daughter over to the hospital a few days ago, we came to the children’s ED, and the staff here were very good. After my daughter received an x-ray we got a bed on the blossom ward, this ward has been great. The rooms are lovely and clean and there lots of room for the both of us. The food we have been given has been lovely, it’s great the way they offer the parents some food as well.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: MG22
title: A very efficient service
body:
Great experience with Tats, Jayne, Amber and Omar. I was very nervous but they put me at ease. They talked me through why I was there and what was going to happen  
It was a very efficient service. I was very impressed.  
Thank you so much.

readBy.name: Royal Cornwall Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: very well laid out and a great place for sick kids
body: We were advised by the GP to bring my son over to Craigavon hospital, we got seen right away by some medical staff and were given a room to rest in. everyone has been so helpful and caring to us, I have no concerns the staff provide great care. We have lots of room on the ward and it’s very clean, it’s very well laid out and a great place for sick kids.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Captain Nick
title: Physiotherapy for shoulder injury
body: Decided to try Physio as an alternative to shoulder surgery and after 4 consultations, although I am still in occasional pain, I now have full arm movement back again. The physio in particular I was assigned was utterly superb.

readBy.name: United Lincolnshire Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: lovely staff
body: We were advised to come over to Craigavon hospital by our GP, the process was quick and we didn’t wait long to be seen by some staff. My daughter has been receiving great care, the staff are all lovely. The food has been very nice, we have also been making use of the shop in the hospital. The facilities are cleaned very well by the cleaning staff I have no complaints what so ever.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Richard C
title: Amazing Endoscopy service
body: Amazing staff,  amazing treatment and amazing tea.

readBy.name: NHS Lanarkshire

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: The treatment from staff is amazing
body: The treatment from the staff in here is amazing there all such lovely down to earth people, they have been providing great care to my son and I’m so thankful for all they have done. My son and I feel very safe and comfortable here in blossom, it’s such a lovely friendly environment. They have great facilities and it’s very clean, the food has been good and the communication with the GPs and nurses is excellent.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: earthpc96
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Good atmosphere
body:
I came into Ward 3 after I had a fall. I have been here for almost one week.  
The nurses , carers and the food have all been excellent. The staff had the time, patience and were very understanding to my care needs. I found Ward 3 relaxing.  
I found everything about Ward 3 very good. There was a good atmosphere on the Ward with staff and patients.  
I could not say anything negative about Ward 3

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emzaa1x
title: Pregnancy & Labour experience at PRM
body: I would just like to thank everyone at PRM hospital Glasgow. The care I received whilst pregnant and afterwards was amazing. I truly cannot fault any of the staff and infact everyone who I came into contact with is a true asset to our NHS and our wee babies. I had GD, high blood pressure and was consultant led, this meant frequent visits to day care big shout out to Marion & Alice who always looked after me with a big smile and humour! (Even after my baby was born), visits to triage & Karen who was kept as my consistent midwife during routine appointments. I was then induced & had a really positive experience, then was moved down to the Labour ward where DRs Alastair & Didi looked after me along with Laura & Katie. My wee girl was born at 10.42 at the end of June and had the support from Ruth & Sherish, even more special that my baby was number 40 for Sherish. Then onto the post natal ward where I was again looked after with such loving kindness (my first baby and was clueless). A huge big thank you to everyone you made my pregnancy although it wasn’t smooth a really positive one & my Labour was amazing. Thank you so much everyone. Lots of love Mum & baby C x

readBy.name: NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde
Partnership for Change

author: uniformcn43
title: Long wait for results
body:
1. I was referred to the Central Middlesex Hospital Cardiology Department with chest pain complaints and had an appointment in May 2022. I attended the department, but had to wait close to 2 hours to be seen, while other patients who arrived after me were seen before me. I asked reception to check that my arrival had been noted, and they confirmed it had been. It later turned out that there was a miscommunication and/or administrative error on the part of the department that caused the delay.  
2. I was put on a 24 hour ECG in May 2022, and returned the monitor the following day.  
3. It has now been 2 months and I have yet to receive any feedback at all. I have called the department for an update and it has proven nigh on impossible to get through to speak to reception. No one picks up.4. I attended reception in person 2 weeks ago where it turned out that the results were ready, but that they had just not been sent on to my GP. They promised to send the results over on the same day, but as of today, this has not been done - and again, no one answers the main reception number. 5. A draining experience.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

author: Jalou89
title: Put at ease
body: They looked after my Grandad very well for his MRI scan. They talked him through the procedure and put him at ease. They allowed me to be with him and explain things. Made jokes with him to put him at ease.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Daisy77
title: Lucky to have this service
body:
I was referred to Stobhill MIU by NHS 111 following an injury to my toe and virtual consultation.  
I was given an appointment time, but also told that I should be prepared to wait for at least an hour. In fact I was seen after only 45 minutes. 90 minutes after arrival at the MIU I had been seen, x rayed, and treated.  
Communication with all staff was excellent.  
We are very lucky to have this service, and NHS GG & Clyde are fortunate to have such a great team of staff.

readBy.name: NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde

author: Amar:)
title: Amazing midwifery care
body:
I spoke to a fantastic community midwife called Kirsty. She was thorough, reassuring, empathic, professional. She was everything a healthcare professional should be.  
Thank you to Kirsty for putting me at ease and really reminding me of all the reasons there are to applaud the wonderful NHS!  
Her kind, caring manner and ability to listen have given me a positive experience and more reassurance than she will ever know.  
Amazing professionals like you change the feeling and vibe for people who have had complex journeys like mine!

author: Lolms63
title: Care and treatment
body:
Last August I had to go to A&E. I found the clerks where friendly and helpful and as well as this, the waiting area was looking clean and tidy. Was also happy with the care I received from the nurses, auxiliaries and the doctors in A&E department and made sure all the right tests and checks where done to find out the problem.  
And also thankful to the surgeon, nurses, auxiliaries and domestics who wee working with me on the ward before and after my surgery. I can’t praise this hospital highly enough and nearly a year on, I still talk about how happy I was with this hospital.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021

author: AshCaha
title: Outstanding care
body: I was admitted to Newcross Hospital through A&E and Sam looked after me with such care, compassion, attention to detail and good humour throughout the night. Everyone on A&E was so good as were everyone on the next ward I was transferred to from A&E. From that interim ward my transfer to, hand over and stay on my last ward C15 was really good. Every member of staff I encountered deserves high praise and many many thanks for their professionalism, compassion and good humour over such a long and arduous shift in difficult circumstances.

readBy.name: The Royal Wolverhampton NHS Trust

links.id: very well looked after and cared for

author: NHS70
title: Everyone has been exceptional
body:
Admitted for 2nd time in 5 weeks. First for perforated bowel, 2nd cluster flare of diverticulitis.  
The surgical receiving unit staff were exceptional especially Jody who is the most cheerful nurse even after 12 hours in her feet, thank you for keeping me smiling! The staff in ward 9B are brilliant thanks to Emma and the team for doing amazing job and the staff in 9D again you are all amazing. To Mr Alani and his team I am positive and now confident at coming back for surgery.  
Everyone from auxiliary staff, nursing staff, students, surgeon have been exceptional.  
Not all superheroes wear capes!  
Thanks to each and everyone of you involved in my care.

readBy.name: NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde

author: branhy87
title: It’s the very small things that can make such a difference
body:
Turning 50 meant I was sent an appointment for breast screening. Although I am an NHS worker I was still apprehensive about having the procedure for a number of different reasons.  
However, my experience was very very positive. First of all to be greeted with a nice smile on entering reception and been advised where to go and wait was lovely. Other appointments I have attended I have not always had that welcome and trust me it makes a big difference. I didn’t wait long before being taken into a room and the radiographer completely put me at ease. She was so professional and patient and I never ever felt rushed. Before I knew it the procedure was done.  
It’s the very small things that can make such a difference to someone’s experience. I just wanted to thank them so much for the excellent service.

readBy.name: NHS Ayrshire & Arran
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021

author: uk2022
title: Mis-communication and poor care
body:
[Very unhappy with 'Treatment']  
[Very unhappy with 'Team work']  
  
1st day: 10:00am at A&E, see two Doc's Blood test checks.  
Sat around in Reception 12 Hour later, M R scan, up to ward.11:30pm.  
2nd day: 10:00 Doc 1, need to do M R scan, maybe Bladder? Told nurse still no food.  
3rd day: 10:00 Doc 2, ask what's it like to eat and drink?  
me; you tell me have not eaten for 3 days and have not had a dip in me been on water?  
Doc. Get him food! Going for M R scan Friday.  
I waited and waited for doctor to come and tell me what's wrong 6 x Buzzing still no joy .  
Nurse. No food from 1800 you are having surgery  
Me; Am i ?  
4th Day: M R scan, waited all day to see some one put drips in me .  
5th Day: Doc 3 top guy. 11:00am , Told me what is wrong and need to take out Bladder, but because of week end it might be wed to do it.  
5th Day: 15:30 took myself out, Told me come back when they tell me.  
I was so much in Depression I had to get out.  
In my opinion the leadership is so poor, more training needed & more care from nursing staff.

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

title: caring and efficient staff
body: I would like to express my gratitude to the entire Herward staff, from the receptionists, always smiling and ready to help, to the nurses, Doctors for their continuous care. It goes without saying that all this is made possible thanks to the management staff, usually working behind the scene and don't interact directly with the public. A big Thank you and please keep up the Good Work

author: My mothers carer
title: Waiting for the right care for my Mum
body:
My mum is currently on Ward E2 at Stepping Hill Hospital. I have nothing to say about her care there - suffice to say she a awaits a space in the Saffron Ward at he moment.  
My major concern is that I have seen quite a severe decline in my Mum's mental health - i.e. frustration etc due to the fact she is not currently receiving the correct and best treatment for her to be able to make inroads for her to be able to recuperate somewhat and return home. This is and always has been her greatest wish.  
I feel very sad and angry that this is only adding to her already confused state.

readBy.name: Stockport NHS Foundation Trust

author: CJ22
title: Excellent care from the staff
body:
I attended for routine breast screening at ARI in July 2022 at ARI and fainted during the screening. Claire, the radiographer, another Clair, Dionne and all the staff in the Breast Screening Department gave me amazing care and arranged for me to go to A and E for antiemetics, monitoring and to recover. The excellent care and attention I received from the porters to the A & E staff was excellent and to a high quality and my recovery was swift.  
Thank you to everyone who cared for me yesterday. x

readBy.name: NHS Grampian
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021

title: Fantastic Service
body: Been to the Haywood Hospital today 19/7/22 and from the moment we arrived the service is amazing,a security guy got a wheelchair for my wife whilst I parked my car ( free parking) directed us to the right department,on arriving at the bone density department the receptionist was very helpful the nurse/ doctor who did the scan was very helpful explained everything , the nurse who explained the results could not have been more helpful then finally the nurse who did the blood test so caring so to all the staff at The Haywood 5 stars and thank you all so much Paul & Linda

readBy.name: Staffordshire and Stoke on Trent Partnership NHS Trust

title: skin melanoma removed
body: both the doctor and the nursing assistant where  first class explained the procedure and put my mind at rest I'm not Shure if I can mention there names, but the surgery took place on the 15/07/22 . thank you very much.

title: Poor cleanliness night staff poor
body: The weekend cleaners did very little room cleaning the night staff albeit from a private sector were very poor at responding and had to keep on asking for pain relief

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent service
body:
I have needed several appointments for my young child recently and the staff have always all listened carefully , organised timely appointments and checked her record to provide continuity of care where possible. 

The surgery was well organised and we were seen by a GP who was very kind and considerate. She made my little one feel at ease and this meant she wasn’t as worried in the follow up visits to the surgery.

title: Great midwives during delivery
body:
On behalf of my daughter I have to leave a good review of the 2 midwives on duty during my daughter’s childbirth experience.
However when the 2 midwives went off duty that’s where the care ended.
My daughter who had just given birth, and was exhausted, was left in her soiled bedding to basically get on with it, she wanted a shower and I helped her, if I wasn’t there she wouldn’t have been able to do that after being on drugs and having stitches., I cannot believe that she was left like that, there was a midwife and we had to ask her to help get her off the bed.  All she wanted was to have a shower but she couldn’t have managed by her self, her partner was looking after the baby.  She was basically left to get on with it by herself, I feel like this was an insult to her at such a happy occasion I really can’t believe it. I understand that there is limited staff but the after the birth the service fell well below exceptable, almost insulting as I left the ward to be treated by the receptionist waving a box of masks in my face while my new born grandson was waiting with his parents to be seen to.  I feel like this what should have been a happy occasion was marred by  a number of failures and it’s not expected in this day and age, it’s well below what I would have expected.

readBy.name: Stockport NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great doctor's and practice
body:
Throughout the pandemic and since I received a fantastic service from this practice. The call back system was used effectively and I was seen when required on the same day.  

Where I needed blood tests, I was fitted in and always informed of any test results.

My ailments were complicated and often did not make sense but my doctor persisted and followed everything up to try and find a resolution. 

All staff at the practice are friendly and helpful and all doctors I have seen really care and above and beyond.

title: Excellent Team
body:
Visited Accident and Emergency  with a suspected Achilles rupture,
All checked, diagnosed and sorted within an hour of arrival in Dept. At 7:45am
Helpful, friendly staff from reception and throughout.
Follow up call from staff in fracture clinic as promised 
First class team doing an amazing job.
Thank you

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Annoying intruder alarm
body: This practice has an intruder alarm which goes off a couple of times a night, they have been told numerous times about it, nothing has been done.  For those of us having to live nearby and listen to the noise only for it to return a few hours later, is not only annoying but does nothing for ones health, which surely a GP practice should have as their number 1 priority.  Just shows if they cannot get this sorted, what chance do the patients have

title: Trip to A&E after my son injured his head.
body:
The nurses and doctor we saw were all lovely.
Reassuring, kind, helpful and patient with my son and I.
The department was busy and they always came to see us with a smile and a calming reassurance.
The people in the CT department were great too. 
Thankyou to everyone involved in the care of my son.

title: Very Poor Practise
body:
I was set a letter to say make an appointment for blood tests and blood pressure check, if I was to get any medication at all . The Letter was very short saying I had been contacted before ,but I had not received any letter . I made the appointment Had a blood test and a blood pressure reading given by a Nurse . Yet the other day when I rang regarding a Prescription I was told I had not had a blood pressure check there ,I had to tell the Staff when it was  and the reading and was told that it had not been put down properly, So what is the point of going if they can not put it down properly. 
Also I am very annoyed at the way repeat prescriptions are handled .as when I ask for one I never get enough of the blood pressure tablets Or my Pain killers which they say never cut down or leave of f without a Dr guidance, now I am left without them all because the last Script was not enough to cover me before another one went in.
I also sent the surgery a list of my blood pressure readings which I thought was good as mine at the surgery are always higher so we get our own machine and have been using it and getting lower readings and yet the surgery has never had them despite being put in there box.
My Husband and I have completely lost confidence  with the place as no body cares their any more , he is saying why go and get a nurse   to take your blood pressure if they do not put it in the right box  after all they should now how to right down a reading like that.  
After all they are supposed to be qualified . However when you have been prescribed medication nobody should be interfering with it only your DR  .not anybody else .
If this Surgery is going to carry on like this it will be no good at all.

title: Thank you
body:
I gave birth to my beautiful daughter at good hope hospital, as she was my first I didn't know what to expect but the care and support I received was outstanding! From start to finish I had the same two midwifes (one being a student who was that confident I would not have said she was a student!) They were both able to read my body language and do exactly what I needed them to do without me saying a word! Baby was back to back so I was in a lot of pain but they done everything possible to help and explained everything before they done it and gained my consent, I never once felt that me or my baby were at any risk and when we got home I found a lovely note off the midwifes in my baby's red book which was such a lovely touch! 

I just wanted a chance to say a massive thank you and hopefully my two amazing midwifes see this because they honestly deserve so much praise for the way they looked after me!

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Worst practice among all my registered GPs
body:
Very inconsiderate staff and GPs. Twice they called me to their practice and upon reaching on time, they made me wait for like 45 mins. 

Above all, their reception staff is so buzy on call that they don't give a damn about the people waiting for their appointment.

Their availability is so much poor that you will get your appointment after a week or month. Never ever register yourself here. Disappointed to see that I'm paying so much tax for surgeries like this and not even getting proper treatment and availability.

title: Quick and thorough response
body:
I had some concerns about my husbands health we were able to get a face to face appointment within 2 days by phoning and staff wre very flexible in organising the time 
The doctor he saw was very thorough and did a test and organised a follow up examination two days later and blood tests . The doctor was not initially going to do the examination so soon but responded to my husbands description of symptoms and changed the plan which we thought was a really thorough and flexible response 
We were treated with respect and kindness throughout
Thankyou

title: Felt targeted
body: Was using costa today to buy my mum a drink who had just had a stress echo done and had to wait half an hour before she could leave, whilst waiting in the queue a man behind me who was staff for the hospital not sure which department but we’ll known to other hospital staff and costa staff made me feel self conscious and told me I wouldn’t be served without a mask on, when I am exempt due to health issues, and didn’t say it once but several times making me feel pressured into putting one on, which made me feel as though I was suffocating, due to anxiety and anxiety attacks, asthma and other health issues as well as feeling dizzy and chest pains from the heat, I don’t appreciate feeling targeted and pressured by hospital staff it was none of his business in the first place never felt so humiliated and anxious when trying to buy my sick mum a drink

title: Above and beyond
body: I had an appointment at the EPU and from the momment I stepped foot in the hospital I felt cared for, seen and heard. All my questions were answered and I felt like professionals had time for me, whether that’s the nurses, consultant, anithetists or surgeon. I wanted to make special note for the theatre guys as I assume you don’t get the acknowledgment you deserve as you put people to sleep and when they wake up you are gone, you were all amazing and made me feel like a person, and that I mattered and holding my hand as I went under. Just realise how much that kindness means to people so Thankyou

readBy.name: Norfolk and Norwich University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Service
body: Visited walk in centre at 6pm for infected insect bite.  Quick & efficient service, cannot fault.  Thank you to everyone who cared for me.

readBy.name: Locala Community Partnerships

title: Online service
body: Trying to refer myself online to get a doctor's appointment.   Online site doesn't open until 7am.  I start work at 7am so cannot use this service.   Would call doctors from work but cannot stay on the phone for the long duration needed for answering.  Going abroad in two weeks and really would like to see doctor before I go but thinking this is highly unlikely.  I'm a shift worker.   Why are surgeries not moving with the times and having evening and weekend appointments.   To be honest any appointment would be good.

title: Excellent staff
body: From the moment I checked in the staff were efficient and attentive. The whole process was an absolute breeze from start to finish.

title: unsympathetic, toxic staff
body: The staff here were dreadful. impatient, surly, rude and short. They make you fell unwelcome and have no understanding or grasp on how a human being should be treated. I often wonder why we are forced to pay into the NHS, it`s at the bottom of European tables and with staff like this I can see why :-)

readBy.name: Cambridge University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Positive experience
body:
I was a bit worried going for my procedure however the whole experience was explained to me fully and helped put me at ease. 
The operation took place with local anaesthetic, I didn’t feel a thing and I was so relaxed I could easily have fallen asleep whilst the cutting took place. 
The team were very attentive ensuring I was always comfortable and feeling okay. I was in very competent and safe hands. 
I came away from the hospital with the necessary knowledge to recover as soon as possible but also who to contact and what to do if I encounter any issues. 
I still need further procedures in the department and I am 100% happy to return to Dermatology at Bedford South Wing. 
Great team, Great care, Great service. 
I am one very satisfied patient.

title: Awful
body:
- can’t get an appointment. 
- (some) staff are shockingly rude
- Still using COVID as an excuse to call patients back to see if they are worthy of an in person visit. 
- Just don’t say I did’t warn you.

title: Gold Service
body:
I have been meaning to leave this review for quite a while. The whole team at Riverbank are amazing and caring, and we are so lucky to have the practice in Midhurst. Friends in London just tell me of horror stories of trying to see a GP. All of the GP's are 
brilliant, caring and understanding, and having time to listen. Unbelievable service!

title: Receptionist lovely
body: I've called the practice via the phone and the receptionist was quick and helpful to book me a phone consultation with the doctor and attentive to the situation

author: dracoff65
title: DXA scan
body:
My appointment was with Ben. I was put at ease straight away with his friendly and professional manner. He gave me really good explanations about the scan and the processes involved. 
I had lots of opportunity to ask questions came away with clear information about how to maintain healthy bones whatever the result of the scan.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Well organised
body:
I would recommend Chec to my friends and family. I find that everything is very well organised with Chec, never had any problems at the clinic or booking appointments. The only problems I have had with Chec is that sometimes a wait on the phone lines when you call and that I found it difficult to find information of address for clinic.
I was seen by Chec at Severnfields Medical Practice, Shrewsbury

title: Exceptional Service
body: From the moment I entered the clinic the team, whether they be working on reception, in the clinic or the actual GP and clinical team could not have been more helpful. I was going through a scary time in my life and they helped so much with everything I needed to know from medications, to prescription services to talking to me and explaining what my condition meant.

title: Unhelpful
body: When I phoned the surgery the person who answered the phone was incredibly rude and dismissive of my queries. The process to contact them was highly confusing and I am a young person that is not likely to struggle when contacting them. The person who took my call was sighing and had an inappropriate attitude to my questions and was incredibly unhelpful. This surgery has been going downhill for years now and it’s getting to the point where it is no longer sustainable.

title: Incompetent admin team
body: Attended for an endoscopy procedure after limiting my holiday by having to go on a low residue diet for 4 days and take a bowel cleansing preparation,  to be told the admin staff had not entered my appointment in the diary  even though they sent me a letter to confirm the date and time and followed up with a call to confirm the date the Wednesday prior. Consequently I was asked to wait in the car (as per the entry procedures for endoscopy)  on the hottest day recorded in the uk (40 degrees) without being able to drink any water. Whilst the clinical staff eventually recognised it was an admin error and went ahead with the procedure in a professional way, albeit rushed as it was an inconvenience to fit me in for them, this was 70 mins late during which time I felt extremely anxious and close to tears. Possibly as a consequence of all the upset or maybe the rushed timing for the team that had to fit me in, the procedure was significantly more painful than previous endoscopy’s . An apology was never offered. The administration at this practice needs a thorough investigation as it’s incompetent.

title: Excellent care. Help is there !
body: I have needed urgent help several times in the last year and each time the surgery has responded very quickly and provided a face to face appointment within an hour. Ok, sometimes there is a bit of a queue on call waiting but that is to be expected. Once through the person on Reception desk could not have been more kind and helpful.  The GP was excellent as were the staff at FairOak pharmacy. I know the surgery has at times been subject to some poor reviews but those do not reflect my experience. Great team doing an increasingly demanding job in very difficult times.

title: Check-in with I pad not helpful
body:
I don’t know how long people have had to self check-in with an I pad at A&E, but cannot see any benefit for patients.
Is it meant to be a cost saving measure? How can an ipad prioritise patients?
I was here about six months ago, a nurse at reception sorted everyone out, no problems ( apart from the queue) which was fine

readBy.name: East Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Come to this practice if you don't need help
body: While the staff on desk were completely helpful, the doctors I had seen in this practice ignored my concerns, refused to help. After transferring from this poor excuse of a practice, I finally got most of the help I had been requesting for nearly 10 years of being spoken down to and having my issues dismissed.

author: Emma L
title: Great service
body: I had a minor procedure today in the Dermatology department at York Hospital; a department that I have visited relatively regularly over the past 6 years. The staff are always amazing, starting from the reception staff who are always welcoming and happy to help, to the clerks, HCA's, nurses and doctors. They are all incredibly patient focussed, caring, considerate and efficient. Thank you and keep doing what you are doing!

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My care has been dead on
body: My care in the hospital has been dead on so far and I feel like I have been treated very fairly so far with the care exceeding my expectations. The doctors have been so polite and I feel it’s a lot easier to be seen by them when they give such good news to me at least. They have been so easy to understand and have explained my treatment so well. The nurses have been so kind and helpful always getting me anything that I eat. The food has been great and I have had no issues with any of it. The care has been exceptional and I am so thankful for the staff that have looked after me.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Good communication
body: I spoke with one of the receptionist today over the phone. She was very helpful. She listened without interrupting and provided me with the best solution for what I called for. Very helpful

author: missfleur
title: Everyone I have encountered has been absolutely lovely.
body:
I am just over 12 weeks pregnant and have just tested positive for COVID. The care that I am receiving from NUH City Maternity and my community midwife is absolutely incredible. I feel so supported and very safe knowing that I am being monitored by people who really demonstrate that they care. I receive regular phone calls and was promptly sent a covid pack so that I can record my obs.  
I have no reservations about recommending NUH City Maternity as everyone that I have encountered so far have been absolutely lovely. Thank you

readBy.name: Nottingham University Hospitals NHS Trust

author: atlasjb89
title: I for one appreciate everything they do
body:
I was very impressed with the service which I revived from the district nurses in West Bridgford. I received their assistance to dress an open wound that was infected following surgery, this had to be done daily. I found all of the nurses to be professional, considerate and caring.  
I would like to personally say a very big "Thank you" to all of the nurses. They do a wonderful job and I for one appreciate everything they do especially in there difficult times.  
A big shout out the the NHS.

readBy.name: Nottinghamshire Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: colinshiel
title: Recent Surgery
body: In late May, my breathlessness became so problematic I visited my GP, at Marnock Centre, Kilmarnock. I was quickly assessed by my GP and found to be dangerously anaemic. I was referred to Crosshouse where a bleed in my stomach was discovered. After wonderful care by the assessment staff, I was operated on at the beginning of July. Thanks to a fantastic team, the operation was successful, and I stayed in ward 4B for six days to recover. The staff in 4B were tremendous. All the wonderful things one hears about NHS staff could easily be about those who cared for me there over that time. I'm now successfully recovering at home. This is a huge thanks to all those who, with competence and a warm heart, effectively saved my life.

readBy.name: NHS Ayrshire & Arran

author: handsetcm38
title: Helped on my journey
body:
Before I started my journey with my therapist Jason I was very dubious as to whether this CBT therapy would work for me. I have been referred to the mental health various times over the years but did not find it helped me. I felt very vulnerable and I worried that I would not get on with my therapist or that they wouldn't understand me. I was very wrong.  
Jason was patient, understanding and cared about my wellbeing. He helped me learn loads of new skills to deal with day to day life but most of all he helped me learn how to stop and control my OCD behaviours. Before therapy my quality of life was poor. I felt like OCD controlled my life and I couldn't stop the intrusive thoughts that entered my mind all day. Now I am equipped with new skills that Jason has helped me learn, practice and perfect.  
I now live a life full of more self worth, freedom, social interaction with friends/family and I have reached goals I never thought I could reach, Jason gave me my life back, I am so glad that I took that leap of faith when contacting Bromley mental health and that I got referred to someone that genuinely cared about my mental, emotional and physical wellbeing. He was always happy to listen to me, to help me learn how to navigate tricky situations in my personal life and how to have more self compassion. I will always be incredibly grateful to Jason for everything he has helped me with throughout my journey.

readBy.name: Bromley Healthcare

author: bracerf44
title: A pleasant experience all round
body:
The staff were very pleasant, kind and made me feel at ease.  
They were competent and slick in what they were doing when telling me about the positions I’d need to be in for the neck x rays  
A pleasant experience all round

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Domnf34
title: Impressed with the level of care
body: I was admitted to Ward 4 North and very impressed with the level of care, the work ethic and dedication of staff.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Topjaar
title: Condition management programme, Long Covid
body:
I caught Covid in October 2021 and from then on been almost 6 months out of work with extreme fatigue, no energy whatsoever and no sleep. I was advised to apply for the CMP, was accepted, and had several zoom sessions with Loretta and Lorraine and several other Long Covid 'patients'  
Just to be able to speak to people who suffer from the same as you, and to have professionals who 100% know what everybody is going through. The whole program has been a big help and has made a massive positive influence on my health. Keep the program running, it will help loads of others. Great job Loretta and Lorraine, absolutely fantastic

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Public Health Agency
Patient and Client Council
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Deijk63
title: Very short waiting time, very good service.
body: Pre-op assessment. Staff were fantastic, made me feel at ease and explained everything in detail. Very short waiting time, very good service.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: IM22
title: All round first class treatment
body:
I was admitted to DESU in Altnagelvin hospital for surgery and I cannot speak highly enough about the care I received from the moment I was admitted right through to discharge. The nurses were so caring and even enjoyed some light banter which was great recovery medicine post op. To Mr Macleod urologist I am a new man. I have been in pain and discomfort for so long - I feel l have been given a new lease of life.  
To the nurse who found my medal and contacted my daughter, thank you as it was of sentimental value to me.  
All round first class treatment well done to our amazing NHS workers.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: loveqd74
title: Smooth and painless
body: It was all very smooth and painless. Everyone was very kind I was in and finished in two hours. Everything was explained to me clearly and I was allowed to ask questions. I couldn’t have been treated any better. Thank you. Queen Margaret’s Hospital, Kirkcaldy

readBy.name: NHS Fife
Fife Health & Social Care Partnership

author: vulpeculajf87
title: Nothing there is too much trouble.
body:
My daughter was in St Lukes, suffering from Cancer.  
The care she received in there was wonderful. I cannot say how grateful I am to them, there are not enough words.  
All the staff are caring and friendly. She could not have been a better place. Nothing there is too much trouble.  
The kindness they show patients and relatives is limitless. The food is lovely , the rooms are very good, the gardens very pretty  
Every single person who works there are angels

readBy.name: St Lukes Hospice (Harrow & Brent)

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff have all been doing their best to provide great care
body: My time spent on this ward has been okay, the staff have all been doing there best to provide great care to me. The facilities on this ward are laid out well and the cleaners clean the ward regularly. The food has been okay, I suppose its only hospital food and don’t expect it to be much better. The communications with the GPs has been okay.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent service throughout
body: From doctors, practice secretary, to all the other medical and reception staff the service has been faultless. Despite my frequent calls to ask for advice and assistance in getting referrals I was treated with understanding and friendliness and, above, complete professional competence. This has been the case since we transferred to this practice several years ago. Very well done all.

readBy.name: Healthwatch Sheffield

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Great facilities & food
body: I’ve been in 4 north now for a few days, the staff are all very nice, and are always very cheerful and friendly. The food is really lovely, I enjoy most things, always very satisfied. Cleaners do a brilliant job. The care is brilliant, everyone is so calm and reassuring. The facilities in the ward are great, never had any problems.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Quick and easy process
body: My GP advised me to come over to the hospital last week. It was a quick and easy process and I got a bed very quickly which was good as it allowed me to rest for a while as I was very tired and sore. The staff have been providing a great level of care, I’m definitely in good hands. The food has been great I’m really enjoying the different meals.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Superb
body: Fortunately I have not often had cause to trouble the practice but when needed I have found them to be extremely efficient and professional. In this current climate of underfunding, staff shortages and continuing troubles caused by the pandemic I think this should be commended. Well done.

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Food has been a bit cold
body: I came over to Craigavon a couple of weeks ago through the ED. The staff are all lovely, they have been very good to me. The food is not very nice and is often cold. Cleanliness is really good, cleaners always cleaning throughout the day. I haven’t had any problems in this ward at all, everything is great.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Food is okay but ward is very clean
body: Came over to the trauma ward the other day for an operation, food has been okay. Not the best like but will not be here for much longer so it will do. Staff are all really nice an always checking in to make sure I am okay and if I need anything, they are really good. Cleaners are great, ward is always very clean.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I feel as if all my needs are being met
body: The staff on this ward are all brilliant, I feel as if all my needs are being met. They are all such hard workers and always take the time to ask how I’m doing which is lovely. I have a lot of room in this bay, and it’s very clean, the cleaners work hard during the day. The food has been okay, my appetite isn’t the best at the moment.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Always time for questions
body: The trauma ward is brilliant all the staff have been amazing at taking care of me and I am very appreciative of their wonderful care and help. They are working tirelessly every day and especially in this heat it cannot be easy, I really feel for them. Food has been lovely, due to the really warm weather I haven’t had much if an appetite so I have just been eating things like salads and stuff. Cleanliness is always 10/10. The staff are always very good at answering any questions I may have.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Brilliant experience
body: My call was answered promptly by a helpful receptionist who arranged a Drs call for me. The Dr called back within the timeframe given and was really kind and helpful and very informative about the next steps that would be taken.

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Provided me with some good information
body: I was admitted to the hospital via an ambulance, it arrived very quickly and the staff were all wonderful. I got seen straight away and the GPs provided me with some good information, the nurses were also very helpful. I got a bed on the ward very quickly and it is very comfortable, I’m awaiting to receive an operation on my heart. The staff have been excellent, I couldn’t ask for any better care.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
